awd_titl_txt: Multinuclear NMR and IR Spectroscopy of Peroxometal-MediatedBromide Oxidation: Modeling Vanadium Bromoperoxidase
awd_abstract_narration: This award in the Research Planning Grant for women program is                  made by the Chemistry Division to Dr. Martha Reynolds of the                    Chemistry Department, Colgate University.  Multinuclear NMR and                 IR spectroscopies will be used to probe metal-catalyzed                         oxidative brominations.  During the planning period, Dr.                        Reynolds will spend an extended period in the laboratories of                   Dr. Alison Butler of the University of California at Santa                      Barbara learning the needed instrumental techniques and                         assessing the feasibility of these mthods for studying the                      oxidation of bromide by peroxometal complexes.  This research                   will form the basis for subsequent work on synthetic analogues                  of the enzyme vanadium bromoperoxidase.  The project is                         relevant to halogenation reactions widely used for organic                      synthesis by the pharaceutical industry and to studies of                       atmospheric bromoform.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
